system.description:
These tools allow you to turn a specific type of raw material into generic trade goods using your time, effort, and skill. The type of tool determines the materials and amount of time needed. After spending the needed time and materials, you make a profession check with those tools which determines the value of the resulting generic trade goods (on a result of 15 or lower the materials used are wasted).

Material: 1 sp of stone

Time: 1 week (8 hours per day)

DC Value
15 10 gp
20 30 gp
25+ 50 gp

Includes:

  • 1x Backpack

  • 1x Crowbar

  • 1x Hammer

  • 10x Piton

  • 10x Torch

  • 1x Tinderbox

  • 10x Rations (1 Supply)

  • 1x Waterskin

  • 1x Rope, Hempen (50 Feet)
• Your expertise aids you in identifying a stone, metal, or earthen structures date of construction and purpose, and insight into who might have built it.
• Advantage on poison saves and poison resistance.

• Merrek and Myra are known by the other Derelicts as “Rough and Tumble,” for when they are in close combat together they toss one another around, increasing their offensive and defensive output.

    • When side by side, they have advantage on dodges and defensive maneuvers.

    • When side by side, they have advantage on attacks.

• When apart, Merrek and Myra's spiritual link allows them to see through one another’s eyes and communicate with one another over long distances (up to 350 feet) for 1 minute.

    • This allows them to use 2 Brains, Better than 1 even when separated.

    • This can be used a number of times equal to their proficiency bonus and cannot be used again until a long rest.
• Merrek and Myra, when side by side outside of combat, have advantage on all rolls.

• Although Myra has taught Merrek her ability to interrupt shifting and how to shift on command, when the Moon shifts he may roll 1d20.

    • 1-4: You transform into your full Werebear Form.

    • 5-12: You transform into your Hybrid Form.

    • 13-20: You remain as you are or you may choose to transform into your Hybrid Form as a Free Action.

9z0VPOuak43HUzIl.name: Bury
9z0VPOuak43HUzIl.description: • You may attack a grounded creature by gripping the Multipurpose Pickaxe in two hands and swing downward at their feet dealing 1d6 + Strength Modifier in Piercing Damage on a hit and forcing them to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Strength DC or have it be restrained, as you partially bury its body beneath the ground.

nDPHEoDA7ipaJ5Sf.name: Pull Free
nDPHEoDA7ipaJ5Sf.description: • The buried creature, or another individual within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a Strength save against Merrek's Strength DC to try and pull out the stuck creature.

system.description:
• You may attack a grounded creature by gripping the Multipurpose Pickaxe in two hands and swing downward at their feet dealing 1d6 + Strength Modifier in Piercing Damage on a hit and forcing them to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Strength DC or have it be restrained, as you partially bury its body beneath the ground.

      • The creature, or another individual within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your Strength DC to try and pull out the stuck creature.

• A creature can use its action to eat one berry.
    • Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
    • The berries lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.
• At 2nd level, when Myra hits you with a Summoned Energizing Arrow, it grants Merrek 2 Ki.

• A set of wedding bands was given to Merrek and Myra as a marriage gift, giving them the ability to call forth their summonable items, including clothing.

  • Used to call forth your Collision Crystal Gatling in Dwarvengaurd/Hybrid Form.

  • Used to call forth your Magnetic Maul in Hybrid Form.

• Lycanthropes are vulnerable to Silvered Weapons.

    • If a Silvered weapon/projectile remains in you at the beginning of your turn, you take 1d6 damage that cannot be reduced in any way.

items.name: Fist Wraps of Focus - Band Summon

system.description:
• While these wraps don’t deal damage on their own, they do not interfere with your Unarmed Strikes, and in fact, when used to attack, they deal damage equal to your Unarmed Strike damage and are considered Unarmed Strikes for the purposes of features that interact with Unarmed Strikes (Such as a Monk's Flurry of Blows).

  • Additionally, when standing still, you add +1 to your Unarmed Strikes attack rolls and to your Dexterity Saving Throws.

• Lycanthropes are repelled by the Wolfsbane flower.

    • A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried Wolfsbane flower that it can smell.

    • If Wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were Silvered.

    • A successful application of Wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

    • If Wolfsbane remains ingested or a Wolfsbane laced weapon/projectile remains inside you at the start of your turn, you take 1d6 damage that cannot be reduced in any way.
  • GM Notes: Remember to roll twice as you have advantage on all poison saves as a Mountain Dwarvenguard

Prerequisite: Can't Have Moved on your Turn

  • You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube.
    • You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

      • If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away.

        • This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage.

    • You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

    • If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain.

      • Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain.

        • This change lasts for 1 hour.

    • If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

 

Source: Elemental Evil Player's Companion
system.prerequisite: Can't Have Moved on your Turn

system.description:
• Starting at 3rd level, your primary connection to the deep stone allows you to call upon earthen cantrips and spells when Statue of Deep Stone is active.

 

Deep Stone Spell Table

Monk Level

Spell Level

Ki Cost

Spell

3rd

Cantrip

–
Mold Earth

3rd

1

2
Earth Tremor
• While you are wearing no armor and are not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

• The Deep Stone taught you how to manipulate the spiritual energy that resides within you, known as Ki.

    • It further taught you how to expend that energy to manipulate the elemental energy that surrounds you.

    • You can draw on your Ki to perform supernatural, physical feats known as techniques and to perform elemental abilities, spells, and cantrips.

    • You have an amount of Ki equal to your Monk level + your Wisdom modifier.

    • You regain expended Ki Points when you finish a short or long rest, so long as you spend at least 30 minutes of that rest in spiritual meditation with the elements.

  • Ki Techniques (Each is in your Maneuvers Tab)

    • Flow of the River

      • You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Disengage action as a bonus action on your turn.

    • Flurry of Blows

      • After taking the Attack action, you can spend 1 Ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

    • Patient Defense

      • You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

    • Quickened Healing

      • As a bonus action, you can spend 2 Ki points and roll a Martial Arts die.

        • You regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your proficiency bonus.

    • Step of the Wind

      • You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.
• If you have a non-incapacitated ally within 5-feet of a creature, you have advantage on attack rolls.

RWJFgs4SA3HKdn2K.name: Mold Earth Cantrip
RWJFgs4SA3HKdn2K.description:
You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

  • If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage.

  • You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

  • If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

system.description:
• You never leave home without your trusty pickaxes.

  • You are immediately attuned to these magical pickaxes.

  • The pick is both a set of mason's tools and a martial melee weapon which you are proficient in.

  • It deals 1d8 piercing damage on a hit, or 1d10 piercing damage if held in two hands.

    • Add your Dexterity Modifier to the damage.

  • While holding the pick, you gain the following benefits:

    • When using this speed you leave minor disturbances on the surface above.

    • You gain a burrow speed equal to half your movement speed.

    • You can cast the Mold Earth Cantrip, following the two uses active rule.

  • At the end of a long rest, you can create a new Multipurpose Pickaxe by touching a miner's pick or a War Pick.

    • If you already have a multipurpose pick from this feature, the first one immediately becomes a normal pick.

    • The pickaxes only respond to their owners and may not be magically used by any other creature.

opIW9Xe6GMKrYAsC.name: Make a Door
opIW9Xe6GMKrYAsC.description: Punches a hole through most materials and objects.

system.description:
• You can use the Gatling a number of times equal to the Wisdom Modifier of Merrek's Dwarvenguard Form, and regain all expended uses after completing a long rest.

  • Charging up the Gatling takes your entire turn, and no free actions or bonus actions are allowed.

  • Bullet Storm

    • The Gatling unleashes a flurry of Collision Crystal Laser Beams in a 30 foot cone in front of you. 

      • Everything in its path must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d10 force damage.

        • This damage increases to 3d10 and distance increases to 60 feet at level 11 if you spend your time outside of the campaign tinkering with it.

        • This damage increases to 4d10 and distance increases to 120 feet at level 17 if you spend your time outside of the campaign tinkering with it.

  • Make a Door
    • What it says, lol!

autoanimations.label: Collision Crystal Gatling - Wedding Band Summon

system.description:
• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You may use your Disarm maneuver to attempt to knock an item or weapon from a creature's hand.
    • The target must be within your reach and be holding an item (either carried or wielded).
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • The target has advantage if it is larger than you or holding the item with two or more hands
        • Alternatively, a target smaller than you has disadvantage.
          • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target drops the item in its space.

• While you cannot grapple a creature two or more size categories larger than you, you can grab onto it.
    • By jumping onto its back or climbing up a limb, you can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against the creature's maneuver DC to cling to or balance upon its body.
      • On a success, you move into the creature's space and can move upon its body as if it is difficult terrain.
  • While grabbing onto a larger creature, you gain advantage on attack rolls against it.
    • The larger creature may be able to attack you as normal, depending on its limbs or attacks.
      • It can also use an action or replace one of its attacks on its turn to try to dislodge you, such as shaking you loose or bashing you against a wall, forcing you to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against its maneuver DC or fall prone into the nearest space adjacent to the creature, taking its basic melee damage in the process.
  • If the creature chooses to roll over in order to dislodge you, it becomes prone, but you have disadvantage on the saving throw to hang on.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Grapple maneuver to grab or wrestle a creature
    • You must have at least one free hand to attempt a grapple, your target must be within your reach, and the target must be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target becomes grappled.
          • In addition to things that end the condition, you can release the target at any time (no action required).
  • Escaping a Grapple
    • While grappled, a creature can use its action to attempt to escape. It must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
  • Moving a Grappled Creature
    • When you move, you can drag or carry the grappled creature with you.
      • When you do so, your Speed is halved, unless the creature's weight is within your carrying capacity and you are not encumbered by bulky items.
  • Freeing a Grappled Creature
    • You can use the Grapple maneuver to try to free another grappled or restrained creature.
      • The creature grappling or restraining the target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • If it fails the saving throw, the grappled or restrained creature is freed.
        • Additionally, you may move the freed creature 5 feet in any direction.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Knockdown maneuver to trip or push a creature down.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
    • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
      • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and knock the target prone.

• You can use an action or bonus action to make an Overrun maneuver to move through a hostile creature's space by forcing your way past.
    • Make a Strength saving throw against the target's maneuver DC.
      • On a success, you deal basic melee damage and can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn.
      • The creature can choose to let you pass instead of rolling.
      • You have advantage if you are larger than the target, or disadvantage if you are smaller.
      • If you are two or more sizes smaller than the target, you can move through the hostile creature's space without making a save.
      • You still provoke opportunity attacks if you move beyond a creature's reach.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Shove maneuver to push a creature away.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and push the target a number of feet away from you equal to 5 + 5 for every 5 points it failed its saving throw by.
          • You can move the creature in any direction away from you (to the side, forward, or diagonally away).
    • A creature that is shoved off of a precipice is propelled off of whatever it is standing on -- it does not receive any saving throw or ability check to grab onto something to avoid falling down below.

• Allows a character to evade opportunity attacks for the rest of their turn.
    • It’s a defensive tactic used when you want to safely move away from an enemy without risking a free swing.

• Instead of using a weapon to make a melee weapon attack, you can use an unarmed strike: a punch, kick, head-butt, or similar forceful blow (none of which count as weapons).
    • On a hit, an Unarmed Strike deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + your Strength modifier.
      • You are proficient with your unarmed strikes.
      • This damage cannot be halved by a saving throw.
• Allows Monk's freedom of movement.

• You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Disengage action as a bonus action on your turn.
    • Disengage
      • Allows a character to evade opportunity attacks for the rest of their turn.
        • It’s a defensive tactic used when you want to safely move away from an enemy without risking a free swing.

  • Techniques rely on your mastery over your body, and grow in proportion to your self-control.

    • When a technique requires a saving throw, the saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

      • Ki save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

• Starting at 1st level, your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use Unarmed Strikes and monk weapons, which are shortswords and any simple melee weapons that don't have the two-handed or heavy property.

    • As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield, your Martial Arts attacks gain the following benefits:

      • Martial Arts Die

        • You may roll a martial die according to the Monk Ability in place of the normal damage of your Unarmed Strikes or monk weapon.

          • Starts out 1d4 (Currently 1d4)

            • This die changes at levels according to the Monk Level Table.

      • Dexterity Replaces Strength

          • You may use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes and monk weapons.

            • You may do the same to calculate the save DC for a grapple escape saving throw.

      • Quick Strike

        • When you use the Attack action with an Unarmed Strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one Unarmed Strike as a bonus action.

09CNHGIqJyAAmK6u.name: Statue of Deep Stone
09CNHGIqJyAAmK6u.description: • If Merrek does not use his movement, the Deep Stone holds him firmly in place, giving him advantage on attack and defense rolls.

system.description:
• Starting at 1st level, when standing on earth, metal, or rock Merrek can call upon the Deep Stone to cement him in place, steadying his aim.

    • If Merrek does not move during his turn, the deep stone holds him firmly in place, giving him advantage on attack and defense rolls.

effects.name: Statue of Deep Stone
effects.description: • If Merrek does not use his movement, the Deep Stone holds him firmly in place, giving him advantage on attack and defense rolls.

system.description:
• At 2nd-level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

    • This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk table. (Currently 10 feet - Must be applied to Monk Clothing)
• After taking the Attack action, you can spend 1 Ki point to make two Unarmed Strikes as a bonus action.

• When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks.
    • Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker.
    • Addtionally, you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage.
    • Note: You lose these benefits if you are incapacitated or if your speed drops to 0.

• You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

  • Dodge
    • When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks.
      • Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker.
      • Addtionally, you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage.
      • Note: You lose these benefits if you are incapacitated or if your speed drops to 0.

• As a bonus action, you can spend 2 Ki points and roll a Martial Arts Die.

    • You regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your proficiency bonus.

• Taking the Dash action gives you additional movement, equal to your speed, for the current turn.
    • For a creature with a walking speed of 30ft, this means their movement for that turn would increase to 60ft.
      • This bonus includes any modifiers to your speed
      • This also applies to negative modifiers
      • Note: A situation that often causes confusion is when you Dash after standing up from being prone, which costs half of your movement.
        • Creatures with 30ft speed who are standing up from being knocked prone only has 15ft of movement remaining, but Dash doubles the original 30ft, and therefore they can move 45ft after getting up from being knocked prone.

• You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.
  • Dash:
    • Taking the Dash action gives you additional movement, equal to your speed, for the current turn.
      • For a creature with a walking speed of 30ft, this means their movement for that turn would increase to 60ft.
        • This bonus includes any modifiers to your speed
        • This also applies to negative modifiers
        • Note: A situation that often causes confusion is when you Dash after standing up from being prone, which costs half of your movement.
          • Creatures with 30ft speed who are standing up from being knocked prone only has 15ft of movement remaining, but Dash doubles the original 30ft, and therefore they can move 45ft after getting up from being knocked prone.

• Starting at 2nd level, you’ve meditated with fire and trained your body to dance through flames.

  • You gain proficiency in the Performance/Acrobatic skills and your Proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses that Proficiency.

  • Additionally, you have resistance to Fire damage.

pyXxEuATx81EmqVL.name: Quick Strike
pyXxEuATx81EmqVL.description: • When you use the Attack action with an Unarmed Strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one Unarmed Strike as a bonus action.

1TWepyqW4e5CeMEY.name: Quick Ki Strike (Reaction)
1TWepyqW4e5CeMEY.description: • At 3rd level, you can use the Quick Strike feature as a reaction, even if you don't take the Attack action, provided you spend at least 1 Ki point as your action.

system.description: • When you use the Attack action with an Unarmed Strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one Unarmed Strike as a bonus action.

• At 3rd level, whenever you finish a short or long rest, you can touch one weapon, focus your Ki on it, and then count it as a monk weapon until you use this feature again.

    • The chosen weapon must be a simple or martial weapon you are proficient with, and it must lack the "special" property.

activation.reactionTrigger: There's a ranged Weapon attack fired toward you

system.description:
• At 3rd-level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack.

    • When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity + your Monk level.

      • If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free.

        • If you catch a missile in this way, you can spend 1 Ki point to make a ranged attack with a range of 20/60 using the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction.

          • You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack.

2mUe1kgIwmyqVbYi.name: Launch Caught Missile
2mUe1kgIwmyqVbYi.description:
• If you catch a missile in this way, you can spend 1 Ki point to make a ranged attack with a range of 20/60 using the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction.

    • You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack.

system.description:
• If you caught a missile in this way, you can spend 1 Ki point to make a ranged attack with a range of 20/60 using the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction.

    • You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack.

LuPCdV53G8STI7NX.label: Earth Tremor Spell Save
LuPCdV53G8STI7NX.onSave: You take no damage and do not fall prone.

system.description:
• You cause a tremor in the ground in a 10-foot radius.
    • Each creature other than you in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw.
      • On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone.
      • If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared. 

 

Source: Elemental Evil Player's Companion

activation.reactionTrigger: When you take cold damage you may attempt to pop this off.

system.description:
• As a reaction, you may cast Absorb Elements at the cost of 1 Ki against Cold Damage, capturing some of the cold to lessen its effect on you and to then store it for your next melee attack.

    • You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn.

    • Also, the first time you hit with a melee attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 damage in cold damage.

 

Source: Elemental Evil Player's Companion

• As a bonus action, you may choose an area of water you can see within range using 1 Ki.

    • You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

      • You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction.

        • This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage on its own.

      • You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction.

      • You change the water’s color or opacity.

        • The water must be changed in the same way throughout.

      • If you use this ability multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

      • Whatever change is made lasts for 1 hour.

    • Merrek Specific

      • You may surround a creature in water they can easily pass through.

        • The creature is considered "Submerged" for all abilities that state that requirement.

      • You may use it to form a barrier of ice around an object or creature.

      • The amount of damage it can take, inside or outside, before breaking depends on the roll and amount of water used. (DM will provide)

      • With a thought, you can use your connection with the water to instanly melt it.

• Starting at 3rd level, if enough water is plausibly nearby you can draw it to you.

    • Anytime you manipulate water you can freeze it as a free action.

    • You can now breathe underwater and gain a swim speed equal to your regular walking speed.

    • You have the following abilities:

      • Shapeshift Water

        • As a bonus action, you may choose an area of water you can see within range using 1 Ki.

          • You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

            • You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction.

              • This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage on its own.

            • You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction.

            • You change the water’s color or opacity.

              • The water must be changed in the same way throughout.

            • If you use this ability multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

            • Whatever change is made lasts for 1 hour.

          • Merrek Specific

            • You may surround a creature in water they can easily pass through.

              • The creature is considered "Submerged" for all abilities that state that requirement.
            • You may use it to form a barrier of ice around an object or creature.

            • The amount of damage it can take, inside or outside, before breaking depends on the roll and amount of water used. (DM will provide)

            • With a thought, you can use your connection with the water to instanly melt it.

      • Absorb Elements (Cold)

        • As a reaction, you may cast Absorb Elements at the cost of 1 Ki against Cold Damage, capturing some of the cold to lessen its effect on you and to then store it for your next melee attack.

          • You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn.

          • Also, the first time you hit with a melee attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 damage in cold damage.

md0OdEFyxCvhPk0T.label: Elixir of Delayed Doom Bomb Attack Roll

UItlo1isyLgykyLY.label: Elixir of Delayed Doom Bomb - Undead Damage

XqMApIg1PvW49HP3.label: Elixir of Delayed Doom Bomb Saving Throw

system.description:
• When consumed, this potion provides temporary immunity to the zombification virus for 1 day.
    • If already infected, this will cure someone not yet turned undead.
    • If already undead, this potion causes 2d8 radiant damage.

iTCXV3iJO1HG6QnT.name: Produce Flame - 10ft Light
iTCXV3iJO1HG6QnT.description:
• You create a flame in your hand which lasts until the ability ends and does no harm to you or your equipment.
    • The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
  • The flame ends when you dismiss it or you use it to Fling the Flame as a free action.

XmNZ9CtdzvDg7tgt.name: Fling the Fyrst Flame

VtQwZ6jg1nH1QDAK.label: Fling the Fyrst Flame Attack Roll

XmNZ9CtdzvDg7tgt.description: • You Fling the Flame as a free action at a creature or object within 30 feet, making a ranged spell attack that deals 1d8 fire damage.

system.description:
• When invoked, for 1 minute, you can Produce Flame at will.
  • You create a flame in your hand which lasts until the ability ends and does no harm to you or your equipment.
    • The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
  • The flame ends when you dismiss it or you use it to fling the fire as a free action at a creature or object within 30 feet, making a ranged spell attack that deals 1d8 fire damage.
  • This rune has 1 charge per day and regains its charge at dawn
Clothes worn by most commoners.
Heavy, Parrying, Two-Handed

introduce-me.flavor: Dwarvenguard Monk of the Deep Stone
